student_statement: Multiplying a number by zero makes it bigger.
ai_correction: Actually, multiplying any number by zero always gives zero, because you're taking zero groups of that number.

student_statement: A triangle with one 90-degree angle can’t be a triangle.
ai_correction: That’s a common mix-up! A triangle can have a 90° angle — it’s called a right triangle.

student_statement: Fractions with bigger denominators are always bigger.
ai_correction: It’s the opposite — 1/4 is smaller than 1/2. Larger denominators mean the parts are smaller.
Not always. Dividing by a number less than 1 actually makes the result bigger.
